resources: ScarletLetter //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Description How Does Roger Chillingworth Change Throughout the Novel? In the beginning of the novel, Chillingworth is seen in the crowd surrounding Hester Prynne and the prison. His facial expressions and body movement reveal his sharpness, which contributes to the understanding of his background later in the novel. On page 56, the author describes Chillingworth\'s appearance: \n \"... his look became keen and penetrative, like a snake gliding swiftly over them, and making one little pauss.\" \n \"His face darkened with some powerful emotion.\" At first, Chillingworth seems sharp and cunning based on the comparison between his movements and those of a snake. The description of his facial expression as being keen and penetrative creates an image of a sharp-eyed figure focused on one object or person; in this case, he is focused on Hester Prynne, who is standing outside the prison gates. like a very secretive as he puts his finger to his lips when making eye contact with Hester Prynne.
